meanings.def: something that is wrapped in paper or put into a thick envelope so that it can be sent by mail, carried easily, or given as a present
examples: A large package has arrived for you.
I sent the books in one big package.
Police destroyed the suspect package in a controlled explosion.

meanings.def: a box, bag, etc. in which things are wrapped or packed; the contents of a box, etc.
examples: Check the list of ingredients on the side of the package.
package of something a package of hamburger buns

meanings.def: a set of items or ideas that must be bought or accepted together
examples: an aid/a rescue package
a $6.3 billion economic stimulus package
package of something a package of measures to help small businesses
The IMF has put together a rescue package for the country's faltering economy.
The pay freeze forms part of a package of budget cuts.
Under the reform package spending on health will increase.
a jobs package aimed at helping the unemployed

meanings.def: the pay and other benefits that somebody gets from their employer
examples: Some CEOs received pay packages of over $10 million.
a compensation/severance package
The company tries to match the benefits packages offered by other employers.

meanings.def: a set of related programs for a particular type of task, sold and used as a single unit
examples: The system came with a database software package.

meanings.def: to put something into a box, bag, etc. to be sold or transported
examples: package something packaged food/goods
The glasses had been carefully packaged for the journey to England.
package something up The orders were already packaged up, ready to be sent.
package something in something The fan is packaged in a bare white box.
We package our products in recyclable materials.

meanings.def: to present somebody/something in a particular way
examples: politicians who are packaged and presented to the public
an attempt to package news as entertainment
